intro: Hieracium cerinthoides subsp. cerinthoides, commonly known as the meadowhawk's eye, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves.
